titleproper.value: Preliminary Inventory to the Lesbian and Gay Labor Network Records <num>WAG.092</num>

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2018-06-06T18:59:06</date>

corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

unittitle.value: Lesbian and Gay Labor Network Records

abstract.value: LGLN was founded in New York City in 1987 to promote lesbian and gay rights in unions and labor solidarity in the gay community. Activities include the Coors Boycott Coalition, publishing Pride at Work, organizing lesbian and gay committees in unions, and resource referral, particularly regarding AIDS in the workplace and domestic partnership benefits. The collection consists mainly of research files collected by Miriam Frank and Desma Holcomb for their book, <emph render="italic">Pride at Work</emph>. Also included are the organizational files, petition files, LGLN Newsletter, DC 37 Committee, and the Lesbian and Gay Teachers Association newsletter.

p.value: Published citations should take the following form: <lb/><lb/>Identification of item, date; Collection name; Collection number; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Donated by Miriam Frank and Desma Holcomb, 2015. The accession number associated with this gift is 1991.008.

LGLN was founded in New York City in 1987 by Desma Holcomb, Peter Tenney, Vivienne Freund, Harry Franklin and Shelley Ettinger as well as other lesbian and gay trade union activists to promote lesbian and gay rights in unions and labor solidarity in the gay community. Activities include the Coors Boycott Coalition, publishing Pride at Work, organizing lesbian and gay committees in unions, and resource referral, particularly regarding AIDS in the workplace and domestic partnership benefits.

The collection consists mainly of research files collected by Miriam Frank and Desma Holcomb for their book, <emph render="italic">Pride at Work</emph>. Also included are the organizational files, petition files, LGLN Newsletter, DC 37 Committee, and the Lesbian and Gay Teachers Association newsletter.
